faqs.question: My 1970s Lauderhill home has a Zinsco panel—is that a problem?
faqs.answer: Yes—Zinsco panels, like Federal Pacific panels, have a documented history of breaker failure. Breakers that don't trip during overloads allow wires to overheat, creating fire risk. If you have a Zinsco panel (common in 1970s-80s Lauderhill construction), we recommend replacement. Many insurance companies now require it. We provide honest assessments and professional service.

Adding outlets is straightforward and much safer than using extension cords and power strips, which are fire hazards. We can add outlets throughout your home, including dedicated circuits for high-draw items like window AC units or space heaters.
